rival.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a person, group, or organization that you compete with in sport, business, a fight etc
rival.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: This gives the company a competitive advantage over its rivals.
He finished 39 seconds ahead of his main rival.
She was 2 minutes faster than her nearest rival.
a game against their old rivals, Manchester United
They still remain bitter rivals  (=hate each other).
Their sales have now overtaken those of their arch-rival  (=main or strongest rival).
Sheena left her job and went to work for a rival company.
his chief rival for the job
rival.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: one of a group of things that people can choose between
rival.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: The newest model has several advantages over its rivals.
rival.translation[0].note_box[0].section: Who is the champion's main rival?
She finished 7.1 seconds ahead of her nearest rival.
Oxford and Cambridge University have always been great rivals
McDonald's and its arch-rival Burger King
He knows that he has no serious rival for the job.
Hindhead had a convincing victory over their old rivals, Frensham.
Their business is a potential rival for ours.
They have long been bitter rivals.
At the time, France and Britain were major political rivals.
His presidential rivals have vigorously attacked him.
My task is to unite the rival factions within the party.
The rival team's fans were in the other part of the ground.
The street is a war zone between two rival gangs.
There were fights between rival fans after the match.
It may have to merge with a rival company to stay in business.
rival.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to be as good or important as someone or something else
rival.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: The collegeâ€™s facilities rival those of Harvard and Yale.
a stadium to rival any in the world
rival.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: a person, group, or organization that you compete with
rival.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: The authorities hope that such changes will help Italian banks compete more effectively against European rivals.
Jack left his job and went to work for a rival company.
The two men had been rivals for the top job three years ago.
rival.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: one of a number of products that people can choose between
rival.translation[2].definitions[1].exam: The car was a success because it met the needs of car buyers better than most of its rivals.
Your product needs to be better than rival products in precisely specified ways.
rival.translation[2].definitions[2].defi: a BID etc that is competing with another
rival.translation[2].definitions[2].exam: Another travel company has now come in with a rival bid.
rival.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: to be as good or important as someone or something else
rival.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: This notebook computer rivals the power of some desk-top models.
